short_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s: For this puzzle, snap the blocks together and click "▶ Run"!
Snap all blocks together to finish your code, then click "Run".
Add a `North` block to the bottom of the other blocks to finish this code, then click "▶ Run".
Add a `North` block to the bottom of the other blocks to finish this code, then click "Run".
Can you figure out which block you need to add to the bottom of the other blocks to finish this code?
Get the bird to the pig!
Get the bird to the bad pig!
Give this one a try.
What can you add to the end of this code to get the bird to the pig?
Move one way, then another to get the bird to the pig!
Solve this level and get the bird to the pig!
Challenge: Avoid the TNT to get the bird to the pig!
Move one way, then another to get the bird to the pig.
Get that pig!
Get the pig any way you can!
Something is wrong here. Help fix the code to get the bird to the pig!
Trace the path to lead the bird to the pig. Avoid TNT or feathers will fly!
Play with these blocks to help the harvester pick the piece of corn.
Use three `move west` blocks and one `pick corn` block to solve this puzzle.
Use three `Move North` blocks and one `Pick Corn` block.
Add one block to help the harvester pick the corn.
Find the bug and fix it!
Try it yourself!
Try it yourself!
Now the harvester needs to pick corn two times!
Add two blocks to finish this puzzle!
Make sure to pick all the corn!
Pick all the corn.
Try it by yourself! Pick all the corn.
Play with these blocks to help the harvester pick corn.
Help the harvester pick all the corn!
Make sure to pick all the corn!
Can you pick all the corn using only **one** move block?
Can you help the harvester find the bug in her code?
Try it yourself! Can you pick the corn at the end too?
Look at all this corn! Can you pick it all by yourself?
Can you change your code to make the harvester pick all the corn?
You will need **one** `Move South` block and **one** `Move West` block.
Try it on your own!
Can you figure out how to pick all the corn?
Help the harvester pick all five ears of corn!
Try one more on your own!
Get at least one piece of treasure without mistakes to pass!
Get all four piles to pass this level.
How can Laurel get all five piles of treasure using only one `E -->` block?
Fix Laurel's path to get all of this treasure!
Add to the code from the last puzzle to get all of the treasure.
Figure out the code to help Laurel get all of the treasure!
Write the code to get all of this treasure.
**Challenge:** The treasure goes all the way down these stairs!  Write the code to help Laurel get it all.
_"Help me get the treasure from this deep valley."_
Help Laurel get all of the treasure from this cave.
Eureka!  Get as much treasure as you can!
This time you have limited blocks. Get all of the treasure!
Help Laurel get at least **5** pieces of treasure to finish this puzzle.
This is a new type of puzzle called "Artist". Play with the level and draw something fun.
The Artist is trying to draw a line **6** times, but can't get it right.  Can you help?
Help the artist draw a line 7 times to make a garden wall.
Now we need to get the soil ready to plant. Find the bugs in the code and help the artist prepare the ground.
Time to fix the stairs!  Repeat this pattern **5** times so the artist can reach the top of the bushes.
Climb the vine and see where it goes?
**Challenge:**  It's a hidden garden! Let's walk around.
Time to head home. Can you fix this ladder using only one block to help the artist get down?
Let's take the short way home, over the pond. Can you help the artist stay on the stones?
Use what you have learned to draw a picture of what you think the artist saw when he got home.
"It's time to toss the dice! Can you help me draw these?"
Draw as many X's as you can. Can you get 3 in a row?
Need a better playlab/events combo
See if you can figure out what each block does.
Have Daisy the Dragon say something when you click "Run".
Use an event to make Daisy the Dragon switch to a random mood when you click on her.
Get the dragon to finish this level!
Add an event so that the knight runs away from the dragon when you press the right arrow.

Help your knight get all of the flags!

To do this, you'll need to add events to help the knight move up, down, left, and right.

1.  Set the knight to vanish when he runs into the dragon.    
2.  Play a sound when they collide to make it feel more real.
**Free play:** Use your imagination. What can you do to make this game more fun?
Make the animals move down when you press ▼.
Make the animals disappear when you click on them.

long_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s: To get the bird to the pig, snap the <xml><block type="maze_moveEast" block-text="move east"/></xml> block to the bottom of the <xml><block type="when_run" block-text="when run"/></xml> block, then press "▶ Run"!
Attach both <xml><block type="maze_moveEast" block-text="move east"/></xml> blocks to the <xml><block type="when_run" block-text="when run"/></xml> block to finish your code, then click "▶ Run".
Grab a <xml><block type="maze_moveNorth" block-text="move north"/></xml> block from the toolbox and add it to the bottom of the other blocks to finish this code, then click "▶ Run".

There's an extra block at the end of this code!  

Drag it back to the toolbox to throw it away.
Can you figure out which block you need to add to the bottom of the other blocks to finish this code?
Try this one all by yourself!
_"Play with these blocks and try to get me to the bad pig!"_
Give this one a try.

_"Here piggy, piggy!"_

What can you add to the end of this code to get the bird to the pig?
Move one way, then another to get the bird to the pig!
Solve this level and get the bird to the pig!
**Challenge:** Avoid the TNT to get the bird to the pig!
Time for a shorter puzzle!  Move one way, then another to get the bird to the pig.
Get that pig!
Debug this level. Remove the extra blocks, and add the missing blocks. Get the bird to the pig!
Help the harvester pick the piece of corn!
Use **three** <xml><block type="maze_moveWest" block-text="move west"/></xml> blocks to get the harvester to the corn!
Use **three** <xml><block type="maze_moveNorth" block-text="move north"/></xml> blocks to get the harvester to the corn! Don't forget to pick the corn at the end.
Add _one_ block to help the harvester pick the corn.
Can you figure out what is wrong with this code? Help the harvester pick the corn!
Try it yourself!
You have to move in two directions to get to the corn! Help the harvester pick the right direction.
Now the harvester needs to pick corn two times!
Add two blocks to finish this puzzle!
The harvester needs to pick all the corn! Do you see a pattern?

_Thank you for helping me!_ 

Pick all the corn.
Try it by yourself! Pick all the corn.
Help the harvester pick corn!
Help the harvester pick all the corn!
The harvester needs to pick all the corn! Do you see a pattern?
Can you pick all the corn using only **one** move block?

_"I need help to find what's wrong!"_

Can you help the harvester find the bug in her code?
Try it yourself! Can you pick the corn at the end too?
Look at all this corn? Can you pick it all by yourself?
Can you change your code to make the harvester pick all the corn?

You will need **one** <xml><block type="maze_moveWest" block-text="move west"></block></xml> block and **one** <xml><block type="maze_moveNorth" block-text="move north"></block></xml> block to finish this puzzle!
Try it on your own!
Can you figure out how to pick _all_ this corn?
Help the harvester pick all five ears of corn!
Try one more on your own!

**Free Play:** Move Laurel around and get as much treasure as you can. Get at least one item with no mistakes to pass this level.  

* * *

Drag blocks into the workspace and try to figure out how to get treasure.

Move Laurel to the treasure, then use the <xml><block type="collector_collect" block-text="get treasure"/></xml> block to pick it up.

Get all four piles to pass this level.
How can Laurel get all five piles of treasure using only one <xml><block type="maze_moveEast" block-text="move east"/></xml> block?

_"Let's get the treasure!"_

Help Laurel get at least **5** pieces of treasure to finish this puzzle.
Behind the bushes there is a beautiful vine full of flowers.  Can you climb the vine and see where it goes?
**Challenge:**  It's a hidden garden! Let's walk around.

Use what you have learned to draw a picture of what you think the artist saw when he got home.

* * *

### Ideas

[][0]
[][1]
[][2]
[][3]
_"It's time to toss the dice! Can you help me draw these?"_
Draw as many X's as you can. Can you get 3 in a row?

This game is called "Play Lab".  

See if you can figure out what each block does.
Use an event to make Daisy the Dragon switch to a random [][0] mood when you click on her.

Knight time!  Get the dragon to finish this level.

Add an event so that the knight moves toward the dragon when the left arrow is clicked.

Now add an event so that the knight runs away from the dragon when you press the right arrow.  

Move the knight to the right to pass this level.

Help your knight get all of the flags!

To do this, you'll need to add events to help the knight move up, down, left, and right.

Make this game fun by adding more things!

1.  Set the knight to vanish when he runs into the dragon.   
2.  Play a sound when they collide to make it feel more real.   

* * *

Visit all of the goals, then run into the dragon to pass the level.

It's time for the Great Animal Race! Make the animals move down when you press `▼`. 

Who will run the fastest?

Let's make the animals disappear when you click on them.
Try playing with the dog now, then help the other animals join in the fun. You can also add sounds and score points to create a game of Animal Tag!

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseC_maze_programming1_a: If the bird isn't getting to the pig, make sure both of the blocks have been fully clicked together, then click "Run" again.
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseC_maze_programming1_b: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Try something, and if it doesn't work, try something else!

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.1:
Your code should look like this:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="maze_moveEast">
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveEast">
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

Your code should look like this:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="maze_moveEast">
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveEast">
            <next>
              <block type="maze_moveNorth"/>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

Your code should look like this:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="maze_moveSouth">
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveWest">
            <next>
              <block type="maze_moveWest"/>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

Your code should look like this:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="maze_moveEast">
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveEast">
            <next>
              <block type="maze_moveSouth"/>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

Your code should look like this:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="maze_moveWest">
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveWest">
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_collector_loops_challenge1_b:
Start by looping the following commands:

<xml>
  <block type="maze_moveSouth">
    <next>
    <block type="collector_collect"></block>
    </next>
    </block>
</xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_collector_loops_challenge1_c:
Move East twice between each path.

<xml>
  <block type="maze_moveEast"><next>
  <block type="maze_moveEast"></block></next></block>
  </xml>

You can do this with only 14 blocks. Click for one more hint to see a solution.
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_collector_loops_challenge1_d:
Try this!

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="controls_repeat_simplified">
        <title name="TIMES">5</title>
        <statement name="DO">
          <block type="maze_moveSouth">
            <next>
              <block type="collector_collect"/>
            </next>
          </block>
        </statement>
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveEast">
            <next>
              <block type="maze_moveEast">
                <next>
                  <block type="controls_repeat_simplified">
                    <title name="TIMES">5</title>
                    <statement name="DO">
                      <block type="collector_collect">
                        <next>
                          <block type="maze_moveNorth"/>
                        </next>
                      </block>
                    </statement>
                    <next>
                      <block type="maze_moveEast">
                        <next>
                          <block type="maze_moveEast">
                            <next>
                              <block type="controls_repeat_simplified">
                                <title name="TIMES">5</title>
                                <statement name="DO">
                                  <block type="maze_moveSouth">
                                    <next>
                                      <block type="collector_collect"/>
                                    </next>
                                  </block>
                                </statement>
                              </block>
                            </next>
                          </block>
                        </next>
                      </block>
                    </next>
                  </block>
                </next>
              </block>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_collector_loops_challenge2a_a: If something goes wrong, try debugging it. Don't give up!
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_collector_loops_challenge2a_b: Look at this option for getting through the maze. Do you see a pattern that you can repeat?
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_collector_loops_challenge2a_c: To collect all of the treasure, you will either need to add two  <xml> <block type="collector_collect"/></xml> blocks inside your loop, or put the block inside of its own `repeat` block.

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops3_a:
Remember to use a `repeat` <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified">
    <title name="TIMES">???</title>
  </block></xml> loop for better code!
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops3_b: The artist will want to move South to draw this line.

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops4_a: The jump block lets you move forward without drawing a line.

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops4_c: Don't forget to change the number of times the loop repeats.

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops5_a:
Drag out a `repeat` <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified">
    <title name="TIMES">???</title>
  </block></xml> loop, then put the other blocks inside of it. How many times do you need to repeat?

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops6_b: Try writing the moves down on a piece of paper and look for a pattern.

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops7_a: This challenge uses **4** loops, one right after another!
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops7_b:
Notice that every loop makes a stair pattern that goes a different direction.

[][0]
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops7_c:
The loops should do this:

-   Loop 1

    -   Right
    -   Down

-   Loop 2

    -   Right
    -   Up

-   Loop 3

    -   Left
    -   Up

-   Loop 4
    -   Left
    -   Down

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops8_a: How many times should you repeat the pattern to make the ladder?
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops8_b: Try running the code you're given to see what it does.

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops9_a: Remember that jump blocks can be used to move without drawing a line.
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops9_b: You will want to use the W block to solve this puzzle.
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops9_c: Can't figure out where to put the loop? Try writing the code step-by-step and look for a pattern.

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops_challenge1_a: Blocks like this: <xml>  <block type="simple_move_up_right"/></xml> will let your artist move at a slant!
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops_challenge1_b: When you finish one of the dice, `jump` to the next!
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops_challenge1_c: You will need to `move` or `jump` over some of the same lines twice.

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops_challenge2_a: The code to draw an X is already given to you. All you need to do is repeat the X and `jump` to the next spot.
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_artist_loops_challenge2_b: You can use `jump` blocks to move to other spaces without drawing.

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_playlab_events2_a:
This is the block to have Daisy say something:

  <block type="studio_saySpriteChoices">
    <title name="SPRITE">0</title>
    <title name="VALUE">Hi there.</title>
  </block>
  </xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_playlab_events3_a:
This is the block you should use to add the event:

<block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">0</title>
  </block>
  </xml>

    <title name="SPRITE">0</title>
    <title name="VALUE">random</title>
  </block>
  </xml>

    <title name="VALUE">left</title>
  </block>
  </xml>

    <title name="DIR">8</title>
  </block>
  </xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_playlab_events5_a:

  </block>

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_playlab_events5_b:

    <title name="DIR">2</title>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_playlab_events_challenge1_a:
Make the other animals move down when you press `▼`.

    <title name="VALUE">down</title>
  </block>
</xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_playlab_events_challenge1_b:
Change the speed of the animals by using this block:

  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/courseb-2019/s.courseB_playlab_events_challenge1_c:
What will the everyone say when the race is over? Make them talk with this event:

<xml>
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_saySpriteChoices">
        <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
        <title name="VALUE">Woo hoo!</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

  </block>

  </block>
  <block type="studio_changeScore"/></xml>

Make some animals give more points than others.
